what: 1. Arkansas enrollment peaked and is declining
title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Arkansas public school enrollment peaked around 2020 nearly 480,000 students declining since, following national trends.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#CC0000") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#CC0000") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = 2015:2025) +   labs(     title = "Arkansas Public School Enrollment (2015-2025)",     subtitle = "Peak enrollment followed by pandemic-era decline",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, Fayetteville among fastest-growing school districts state, fueled Walmart, Tyson, tech corridor.
code: nwa_growth <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Bentonville|Rogers|Springdale|Fayetteville", district_name)) |>   group_by(district_name) |>   summarize(     y2015 = n_students[end_year == 2015],     y2025 = n_students[end_year == 2025],     pct_change = round((y2025 / y2015 - 1) * 100, 1),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   arrange(desc(pct_change))  nwa_growth enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Bentonville|Rogers|Springdale|Fayetteville", district_name)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Northwest Arkansas School District Growth",     subtitle = "The state's economic engine is driving enrollment growth",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment",     color = "District"   )

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Kindergarten enrollment dropped sharply pandemic parents delayed enrollment, creating smaller cohort now moving elementary schools.
code: covid_grades <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "05", "09"),          end_year %in% 2019:2023) |>   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)  covid_grades

what: 4. Little Rock is no longer the largest district
title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Springdale Public Schools surpassed Little Rock School District become state’s largest, reflecting growth Northwest Arkansas.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  top_10 <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  top_10 top_10 |>   mutate(district_name = forcats::fct_reorder(district_name, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = district_name)) +   geom_col(fill = "#CC0000") +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Arkansas's 10 Largest School Districts (2025)",     x = "Total Enrollment",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic students gone 10% 15% Arkansas enrollment, concentrated poultry-processing regions Northwest Arkansas.
code: enr_full <- fetch_enr_multi(2005:2025)  hispanic_trend <- enr_full |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "hispanic", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 2)) |>   select(end_year, n_students, pct)  hispanic_trend ggplot(hispanic_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = pct)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#2E8B57") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#2E8B57") +   labs(     title = "Hispanic Student Enrollment Growth",     subtitle = "From under 5% to over 15% in two decades",     x = "School Year",     y = "Percent of Total Enrollment"   )

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Arkansas Delta counties seen sharpest enrollment declines agricultural mechanization reduces jobs families move cities.
code: delta <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Phillips|Lee County|Chicot|Blytheville", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) |>   group_by(district_name) |>   filter(n() > 5) |>   summarize(     earliest = n_students[end_year == min(end_year)],     latest = n_students[end_year == max(end_year)],     pct_change = round((latest / earliest - 1) * 100, 1),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   arrange(pct_change)  delta

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: state’s demographics shifting, white students still comprise nearly two-thirds enrollment, Black students concentrated Central Delta regions.
code: demographics <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial")) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "Arkansas Student Demographics (2025)",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Arkansas charter schools growing, particularly Little Rock area district turmoil pushed families alternatives.
code: charters <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_charter, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  charters

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: 60% Arkansas students qualify economically disadvantaged, one highest rates nation.
code: econ <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("econ_disadv", "total_enrollment")) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)  econ

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Small rural districts consolidated absorbed, dozens districts fewer 500 students.
code: small <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(n_students < 500) |>   arrange(n_students) |>   head(15) |>   select(district_name, n_students)  small

title: 10 Insights from Arkansas School Enrollment Data
text: Arkansas’s school enrollment data reveals: Peak decline: Enrollment peaked around 2020 now declining Regional divergence: Northwest Arkansas booms Delta empties Demographic shift: Hispanic enrollment tripled two decades Consolidation pressure: Many small rural districts face uncertain futures High poverty rates: 60% economically disadvantaged trends major implications school funding formulas facility planning across Natural State. Data sourced Arkansas Department Education Data Center.

what: 1. Arkansas enrollment peaked and is declining
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas public school enrollment peaked around 2020 nearly 480,000 students declining since, following national trends.
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, Fayetteville among fastest-growing school districts state, fueled Walmart, Tyson, tech corridor.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Bentonville|Rogers|Springdale|Fayetteville", district_name)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   summarize(     y2015 = n_students[end_year == 2015],     y2025 = n_students[end_year == 2025],     pct_change = round((y2025 / y2015 - 1) * 100, 1)   ) %>%   arrange(desc(pct_change))

title: Arkansas School Data
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("almartin82/arschooldata")

title: Arkansas School Data
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Arkansas School Data
code: import pyarschooldata as ar  # Check available years years = ar.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year df = ar.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years df_multi = ar.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # State totals state_total = df[(df['is_state'] == True) &                  (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                  (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]  # District breakdown districts = df[(df['is_district'] == True) &                (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)

title: Arkansas School Data

title: Arkansas School Data
text: Levels: State, district (~235), school (~1,100) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, American Indian, Pacific Islander, Two Races Special populations: Economically disadvantaged, English learners Grade levels: K-12

text: District IDs: 7 digits (e.g., 0401000 = Bentonville) School IDs: 7 digits

what: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Arkansas Department Education (ADE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data ADE Data Center Annual Statistical Reports (ASR), transforming tidy format analysis.

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Arkansas uses hierarchical ID system: District IDs (LEA): 7 digits (e.g., 0401000 = Bentonville) School IDs: 7 digits (e.g., 0401004)

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Arkansas Department Education systems: ADE Data Center: https://adedata.arkansas.gov/statewide/ Annual Statistical Reports: https://dese.ade.arkansas.gov/Offices/fiscal--administrative-services/publication--reports/annual-statistical-reports

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Enrollment Grade/Race: 2005-2025 via ADE Data Center Annual Statistical Reports (detailed demographics): 2006-2024 Pre-2005 data may different formats

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

text: Removes cached data files.

text: Invisibly returns number files removed

title: Clear the arschooldata cache — clear_cache
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear only 2024 data clear_cache(2024)  # Clear only tidy format data clear_cache(type = "tidy") } # }

what: Download enrollment data from ADE Data Center — download_ade_enrollment
title: Download enrollment data from ADE Data Center — download_ade_enrollment
text: Downloads enrollment data ADE Data Center's Statewide Information System Reports. uses web scraping since ADE Data Center uses ASP.NET postbacks rather direct URLs.

text: end_year School year end level One "state", "district", "school"

text: Data frame enrollment data NULL download fails

what: Extract district ID from school ID — extract_district_id
title: Extract district ID from school ID — extract_district_id
text: Arkansas school IDs embed district ID first 4 digits. District IDs end "000" (e.g., 0401000 Bentonville district, 0401004 school district).

title: Extract district ID from school ID — extract_district_id
code: extract_district_id(school_id)

title: Extract district ID from school ID — extract_district_id
text: school_id Character school ID (7 digits)

title: Extract district ID from school ID — extract_district_id
text: Character district ID (7 digits ending 000)

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads returns enrollment data Arkansas Department Education.

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: fetch_enr(end_year, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year School year end (2023-24 = 2024). Valid range: 2006-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. Currently returns district-level data Annual Statistical Reports. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Force fresh download enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

code: fetch_enr_multi(end_years, tidy = TRUE, use_cache = TRUE)

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi

what: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
text: Returns range school years enrollment data available Arkansas Department Education.

title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years()

title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list three elements: min_year earliest available school year end (e.g., 2006 2005-06) max_year latest available school year end (e.g., 2025 2024-25) description Human-readable description data availability

title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2006 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2025 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Arkansas enrollment data is available from 2005-06 (end_year 2006) through 2024-25 (end_year 2025). Data comes from the Annual Statistical Reports published by the Arkansas Division of Elementary and Secondary Education." #>  # Returns list with min_year, max_year, and description

what: Download raw enrollment data from Arkansas ADE — get_raw_enr
title: Download raw enrollment data from Arkansas ADE — get_raw_enr
text: Downloads district school enrollment data Arkansas Department Education. Uses Annual Statistical Reports district-level data demographics, can supplement ADE Data Center school-level data.

title: Download raw enrollment data from Arkansas ADE — get_raw_enr
code: get_raw_enr(end_year, include_schools = FALSE)
